title: Trying to play Zoe makes me miss Teambuilder again.
body: So ridiculously hard to get Zoe in a draft pick game (blind is just toxic).

replies.body: We should simply get rid of Blind Pick. I have no good memories of that and anything it can do, Team Builder can do it better plus there won't be any lane/pick fight forcing you to dodge a and forced to wait to re-queue again.
For the most part I agree with you, but blind pick has one advantage.  It is a much faster queue style if you (for some reason) don't really care what role you play.

That's the only advantage, but the negative sides of BP are so overwhelming: ppl fighting for lanes, terrible teamcomps, the faster connection gets to instalock the champion they want, etc. That I'd gladly wait 2-3 mins more to get in a less toxic enviroment.
Yeah I'm just saying there are probably a lot of players who prefer BP, and that would be why they wouldn't remove it.
I'm just asking but when was the last time you  guys played blind and how much did you play it. Because I have more toxic lobbies in rank then I do blind

I play blind all the time.

But I'm level 13.

I played blind a couple times in the last month or so (a couple of friends wanted to) and yeah, it's a race to what position you get.  As I main mid and want to play Zoe, this is an absurdly difficult feat to pull off against several other players going for the same role and champion.

After champ select it's like a regular game, but champ select in Blind pick is just frustrating.

Well in this case it's partially because you are trying to play a new champ. It does happen but like I played 5 games last night in blind and all of them went smooth but like every other game of draft I play someone types  " mid :^)"

Those are some bizarre draft games you played.  Every so often that will happen with me, but most often it's just someone asking if I'm willing to trade positions (and sometimes I am).

And blind pick has always been a pain trying to get mid.

Finally this post was specifically about trying to play the new champion.  Saying that it's just because I'm trying to play the new champion is like saying I can only play because I have access to electricity.  It's an assumed variable in the discussion.
